metadata.title: CVE-2014-3625 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in Pivotal Spring Framework 3.0.4 through3.2.x before 3.2.12, 4.0.x before 4.0.8, and 4.1.x before 4.1.2 allowsremote attackers to read arbitrary files via unspecified vectors, relatedto static resource handling.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-beans-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-context-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-context-support-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-core-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-expression-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-instrument-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-jdbc-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-jms-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-orm-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-oxm-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-test-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-transaction-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-web-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 3.2.12-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.12-1').
